title: Photos: Deadly blizzard rages in US, Canada on Christmas
description: Millions of people hunker down against a deep freeze to ride out the winter storm.

title: China stages ‘strike drills’ around Taiwan, citing provocation
description: Taiwan accuses Beijing of destroying regional peace and trying to cow its people.

title: How has hate speech in France led to violence?
description: Kurds have been attacked in Paris and their anger is growing.

title: Blizzard kills dozens in US, thousands of homes without power
description: Winter storm traps people in cars, causes power outages and kills at least 24 as temperatures plummet drastically.

title: Putin says Ukraine invasion aims to unite ‘historical Russia’
description: Russian president says Moscow is willing to negotiate and accuses 'geopolitical opponents' of trying to divide Russia.

title: Paris shooting suspect has a ‘pathological hatred of foreigners’
description: The 69-year-old man 'always wanted to kill migrants or foreigners', the Paris public prosecutor's office says.

title: US warns of potential attack on top hotel in Pakistan’s capital
description: The US embassy in Islamabad issues a security alert to Americans, warning that the Marriott Hotel could be targeted.

title: China to stop publishing daily COVID figures of cases, deaths
description: The decision by the NHC to scrap the daily virus count comes as COVID cases surge across multiple Chinese cities.

title: Ex-Maoist rebel leader Prachanda becomes Nepal PM for third time
description: Prachanda will head the new government until 2025 as part of a deal reached with another party.

title: Pope urges end to ‘senseless’ Ukraine war in Christmas message
description: Francis says during traditional 'Urbi et Orbi' blessing and message the world is experiencing 'a grave famine of peace'.

title: Sri Lanka’s cancer patients struggle amid economic chaos
description: Hundreds of people have had their treatment upended by the country's major economic crisis.

title: Dozens of Rohingya land in Indonesia after a month adrift at sea
description: Local police say 58 men arrived on Indrapatra beach at a fishing village in Indonesia's Aceh Besar district.

title: China defends Ukraine war stance, aims to deepen ties with Russia
description: Foreign Minister Wang Yi defends Chinese position in Ukraine, hails 'historic' improvement in ties with Arab countries.

title: I wish for a silent Christmas
description: I have suffered from tinnitus for 25 years and I wish I could know peace and quiet once again.

title: Photos: Thousands descend upon Bethlehem to celebrate Christmas
description: Thousands of visitors descended upon the traditional birthplace of Jesus.

title: Without food and clothes, DRC’s displaced face grim Christmas
description: Hunger and cholera stalk the tens of thousands who escaped M23 rebel advances in North Kivu.

title: Iranian rapper wins appeal against protests-linked death sentence
description: Court accepts Saman Seyyedi's appeal, but 22-year-old Mohammad Ghobadlou’s bid is rejected and could be executed soon.

title: Zelenskyy says Ukraine will create its own Christmas miracle
description: The message of defiance came as at least 10 people were killed in a missile attack on a market in Ukraine's Kherson.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 305
description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 305th day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: Rescue efforts for 18 trapped after Xinjiang gold mine collapse
description: A total of 40 people were working underground at the gold mine in Yining county at the time of the collapse.

title: Family gather by Pele’s bedside at Sao Paulo hospital
description: Son of Brazilian football legend joins sisters at Albert Einstein Hospital amid concerns over 82-year-old's health.

title: Kari Lake loses bid to overturn Arizona vote results
description: Judge throws out Republican Kari Lake’s challenge of her defeat in the Arizona governor’s race to Democrat Katie Hobbs.

title: US blizzard kills 18, leaves hundreds of thousands without power
description: Fierce storm leaves 300,000 homes and businesses without power and at least 18 dead from exposure and icy car crashes.
